medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain in right upper quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced abdominal pain for 2 days, starting after eating hot dogs for dinner on the night prior to admission. The pain was described as crampy/achy and persistent, with one brief episode of relief during the morning of admission. The pain worsened after eating cereal, accompanied by several episodes of non-bloody, bilious emesis. Pain intensity increased from ___ to ___ after receiving IV dilaudid. No prior episodes of similar pain were reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (DM2), Hypertension (HTN), Hyperlipidemia (HLD), Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH).
medical_history.family_history: Father with cerebrovascular accident (CVA), mother with colon cancer at age ___.
